metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23222 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A man-in-the-middle attacker can inject false responses to the client's first few queries, despite the use of SSL certificate verification and encryption.

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. mdeslaur> Plan is for postgresql-13 to be removed from jammy, marking as deferred for now.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
